Case reference: 2014003425.CaseDesc: Christopher Giberson, went missing from the Saint John Regional Hospital on Friday, January 28th, 2000, at 7:00 p.m. where he was taken for treatment and then assessment, but he walked away before being seen by staff.

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1995, Gareth Austin and Dominic Park were seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2014003102.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1972, David Kyak was seen for the last time in Iqaluit, Nunavut.

Hat: Canvas, Blue, Ball cap, Polar bear crest

Case reference: 2014002337.CaseDesc: Timothy Peifer was last seen on the long weekend in September, 2002 in the Caddy Lake area of Manitoba.  Mr. Peifer's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014006219.CaseDesc: On the night of the 17 to 18 August 2013, Benoit Germain was seen for the last time while he was attending a truck show in Baie-du-Febvre, Quebec. His car was found abandoned a few days later on a trail to a wooded area north of La Tuque, Quebec. Benoit has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020003.CaseDesc: Kelly Rideout was reported missing to Chilliwack RCMP on August 28, 2011.  She is believed to have lived a high risk life style and her disappearance is suspicious.  Police believe that Miss Rideout was the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2016066675.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1970, skeletal remains were located 125 km west of Thunder Bay on Highway #17. Shoes, socks and a coat were also located in the area.

Case reference: 2018040315.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Joshua Hill was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020028.CaseDesc: Chantelle Bushie was reported missing by her family on September 14, 2009. She has not been heard from since December 2007. Chantelle was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2005003999.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1990, a Caucasian male was found on a park bench at George Brown College near 147 Baldwin Avenue, Toronto. This male may have been a smoker. His appendix is present and he has a left-sided hernia of the diaphragm.

Hair: Brown, Short, grey beard and moustache
Money: Copper, Several pennies were found in his pocket.
Boots: Brown, vinyl ankle boot with side zipper
Mark: Right Leg, small ulcers and bruises
Left Leg, small ulcers and bruises
Amputation: Left Ring Finger, missing the tip

Case reference: 2017021635.CaseDesc: On April 24th, 2017, Kevin Sadownyk was last seen in Okotoks, Alberta. Kevin’s truck was found abandoned just outside of Banff, Alberta the next day.

Case reference: 2014003747.CaseDesc: Karoly John "Charles" Horvath, a visitor from England, arrived in Kelowna BC in early May 1989.  He worked throughout the community at part time jobs and stayed in a local hostel and at a local campground.  He was last seen on Friday, May 26, 1989.  All his belongings were left behind at the campground where he had been staying.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, side profile of a skull with mohawk style haircut

Case reference: 2018008750.CaseDesc: On February 17, 2018, Ryan Shtuka was last seen at approximately 2:10 am and was believed to have left a party on Burfield Drive to walk home to his residence located a short distance away in Sun Peaks. Ryan did not attend his job as scheduled later that day and has not been active on social media or his cell phone since.

Shoes: Size 11, flat bottom sole shoes similar to VANS
Shirt: White, Grey, Button Up, Grey arms and collar, partial button up

Case reference: 2020008363.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1981, at approximately 1:00pm, Dick Yeagar was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Dick had been evicted from his apartment on August 15, and did not show up to work the following day.

Case reference: 2011002999.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Pringle is a 61 year old male who was last seen on August 28th, 2010. Mr. Pringle takes medication and when he is not on his medication he becomes agitated and aggressive and makes poor decisions. Mr. Pringle last had his medication on August 27th. All family and friends have been interviewed and no one has seen or heard from Mr. Pringle. Last Seen: walking on Great Northern Road by Second Line East on August 28th, 2010 at 2 pm.  At the time Mr. Pringle was not carrying anything with him and was alone.

Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2013000069.CaseDesc: Richard Riquier was last seen in Montreal on April 17, 1973. He might be in a religious cult in the United States or in India.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were seen last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000110.CaseDesc: Robert Gorassi is a full time resident in Toronto and was on an outing at Kinark Outdoor Centre where he was last seen at 4:30 p.m on October 25, 2012.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Grizzled beard, moustache & sideburns

Case reference: 2014002923.CaseDesc: On March 27, 1998 Jacqueline Olynyk was observed to be walking by the Red River in Winnipeg, MB.  Miss Olynyk has not been heard from or seen since that day.

Case reference: 1992003440.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1984, Daniel Worobec, 18 years old, was last seen in Lanigan, SK. A witness stated that Mr. Worobec told him he was waiting for a ride. Searches and investigation have failed to locate Mr. Worobec

Boots: Brown, cowboy boots with square toes
Hat: Blue, White, ball cap with writing on it

Case reference: 2006004599.CaseDesc: Igor Tikhomirov jumped or fell off an oil tanker into Lake Ontario en route from Holland to Sarnia on May 12, 1996.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2010003999.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday May 28, 1999, Tammy Lamondin, age 20,  was with friends on Main Street in Newmarket. She remained in their company until sometime after midnight. In the early morning hours of May 29, 1999, Tammy left the Newmarket area with a male acquaintance. She was not seen again. The police conducted an investigation but were not able to locate her.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Dolphin above right ankle

Case reference: 2014005157.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2008, Heinz Meyer was seen for the last time in Haines Junction located in the Yukon. His vehicle was later found on Marshall Creek Road in Haines Junction.

Jacket: Cloth, Dark Green, Light Green, Camouflage

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2012020152.CaseDesc: This adult male washed ashore at end of trail # 3 at UBC in Vancouver.

Hair: Brown, Short, Crown of dark hair and a goatee
Teeth: Good, Superior dental health, total absence of dental work, pronounced overbite and crowded lower teeth

Case reference: 2018023712.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2018, Elsa Vargas was last seen near her home in Chateauguay, Quebec. Ms. Vargas also has citizenship in Costa Rica.

Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right side

Case reference: 2006018999.CaseDesc: Sean MacIntyre was 13 years old at the time of a boating accident on July 25, 1980. The boat he was in started to take on water just after leaving Cockburn Island. The boat sank quickly in Lake Huron, North Channel, 2 kilometres Southwest of Bigsby Island. Occupants of the boat put on life jackets. Sean slipped out of his life jacket and is presumed  drowned. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2020011788.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1982, Ian Shim was seen for the last time when he checked into the Gran Hotel in Pereira, Columbia. Ian, a resident of Toronto, Ontario, was on vacation in Colombia. Shortly after checking in, Ian had gone for a hike, but never returned to his room to collect his personal belongings.

Case reference: 2013000073.CaseDesc: Monique Heneault was last seen on June 4, 1986, in Montreal. Mme Heneault lived by herself in an apartment. It seems as though she left her apartment suddenly because there were left overs from her meal found on the table and counter. She had rented a chalet in Labelle, but never arrived.

Case reference: 2019028156.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2019, Tyler McMichael was seen for the last time riding his bicycle at the intersection of Commissioners Road East and Wellington Road in London, Ontario. It is believed that Tyler was heading to the Chatham area.

Case reference: 2012020015.CaseDesc: Veronica Lem was reported missing on June 11, 2009 from Richmond, BC. She missed a flight from the Vancouver International Airport to Toronto, Ontario. Miss Lem may suffer from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2017061069.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1976, John Winer was seen for the last time as he sat on a railing near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Some of John’s personal belongings were found near the railing.

Case reference: 2015015560.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2015, Misty Faith Potts, from the Alexis Nakota Sioux First Nation, was seen for the last time when she had been left at the side of the road to walk a short distance home.

Case reference: 2014002743.CaseDesc: On January 16, 1994, Yoann Crouzatier was reported missing after leaving the family residence in Laval, Quebec. Yoann has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Beige, Three-quarters with fur trimmed hood
Boots: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal tips

Case reference: 2019045788.CaseDesc: On March 11, 2019, the remains of an adult male were found in a forested area in North Burnaby. He is estimated to have gone missing around March 2013, and may have been despondent at the time.

Socks: White, Black, Black on toe area and heal
Sweater: Synthetic, Light Green, Hoodie, Fleece, "Athletic" on the front, size M, Giordano brand
Belt: Leather, Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal steel clasp

Case reference: 2006025399.CaseDesc: Walter Mesem was last seen on April 25, 1982, driving his vehicle in the Eldorado area. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Mesem.

Coat: Green, Hand knitted cuffs, zippered front

Case reference: 2011001499.CaseDesc: At the time of his disappearance, Luke Joly-Durocher was visiting friends in North Bay, Ontario. He resides in Temiskaming, Quebec. Video surveillance showed Luke being refused entry into Cecil's Eatery and Beer Society at approximately 11:54 p.m. He left by himself and has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Shirt: Grey, T-shirt, may have had a small purple animal logo on the bottom corner
Belt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Studded belt, black on the front and purple around the waist
Deformity: Right Forearm, Thinner than left forearm

Case reference: 2014002983.CaseDesc: On the 14th of June, 1986, Joseph MAJOR, 75 years old, was reported missing from a care home in the Hudson Bay district, SK. Extensive ground searches of the area failed to locate Mr. MAJOR.

Case reference: 2006022099.CaseDesc: Duane Wicklund and Edward Kotula were last seen on October 7, 1967, in a loaded boat on Sturgeon Lake. They were vacationing in the area and heading to Margaret Resort on Harris Bay. Neither has been seen since and both are presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Nose, from nose to upper lip

Case reference: 2014006184.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1977, Jacques Chaput left the family home in Trois-Rivières, Quebec following a disagreement he had with his mother and he never returned. Numerous steps were taken by his family to locate him, but they were unsuccessful. Jacques was officially declared missing by his family in 2013.

Case reference: 2014005610.CaseDesc: Roman Drag was last seen in the early hours of May 23, 2011 fishing at the top of the Bassano Dam in Bassano, AB. Roman and a friend were night fishing on the shore of the Bow River. His black jacket and fishing gear were found in the place where he was last seen. Search teams located a pair of glasses but were not able to locate Roman.

Case reference: 2020009327.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2020, James Garnett was seen for the last time at approximately 9:25 pm when he was exiting a bus onto Douglas Avenue near the Reversing Falls Bridge located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Hat: Blue, White, Toque, Has white snowflakes

Case reference: 2014001900.CaseDesc: Andre Gauthier was last seen at approximately 10:15 pm the evening of September 23, 1984 near Simms Corner on the west side of Saint John, NB.

Other: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Lighter with "Andre" engraved on the front, "July 10, 1984, Irene + Paul" on the back

Case reference: 2015069712.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Blake McCool was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006241.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2013, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Ranjit Singh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ranjit was visiting Toronto from India was scheduled to return on a 5:00 p.m. flight, but he never boarded the plane.

Case reference: 2005000599.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2005, this male, believed to be Caucasian was found on the bank of a reservoir in the "Pine Valley Open Space" located at 7211 Pine Valley Road, north of Highway 7, in Vaughan, Ontario. Nearby bed linens, clothing, personal belongings and food suggest that this person was homeless and living by the reservoir. The state of preservation of the remains is suggestive of a lengthy time since death (greater than one year) however, a newspaper dated to January 9, 2005 was found amongst this man's belongings suggesting a post-mortem interval of 4 months.

Teeth: Poor dentition with loss of most teeth. Teeth in his upper jaw have amalgam restorations.
Jacket: Black, Dark Green, Mark's Work Wearhouse, winter
Deformity: Right Eye, A lesion, likely a tumor of the face
Amputation: Left Little Finger, end of the finger

Case reference: 2014001128.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1991, the body of an unknown female was found floating in the Fraser River in New Westminster, BC.  She was observed on the water directly under the Patullo Bridge between the wharf and a fishing vessel called the "Sea Cap X". The female had been in the water for a prolonged period of time and may be of Aboriginal or Asian descent.

Belt: Leather, Blue, With a belt buckle
Jewelry: Gold, Hoop earrings in both ears
Gold, Cardinal brand wristwatch, right wrist
Scar: Right Wrist, 3 cm horizontal and 1 cm oblique

Case reference: 2012020109.CaseDesc: David Fortin was last seen while waiting for the school bus on the morning of February 10, 2009, in Alma, Quebec. He was to take the school bus at approximately 7:50 am to get to the Camille Lavoie High School in Alma. However, he never got onto the bus and did not report to school. According to his family, David was a victim of bullying and intimidation at school for several years.

Case reference: 2006026599.CaseDesc: On August 1, 1995, William Reed left his residence and left a note saying he was going fishing. His truck was located parked near Gibson Mill Road, Phelps Township, with the keys and his wallet inside.

Hat: Green, cap with white lettering on the front

Case reference: 2012020061.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 2008, Amber Mcfarland went to Smitty's lounge with her boyfriend and an acquaintance of his. There they socialized with friends for a while and then moved to the bar at the Canad Inn. They left Amber's vehicle at the Canad Inn and went to the Cat and Fiddle Bar where they continued to socialize. Video surveillance at the bar confirms that shortly after 1:00 am on October 18, 2008, Amber, her boyfriend and his acquaintance entered the attached beer vendor and purchased a case of beer. The three of them exited the vendor and walked into the parking lot. Amber has not been seen or heard from since. All of Amber's cell phone activity and bank activity has since ceased.

Purse: White, Black, Checkered or plaid pattern

Case reference: 2014001591.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1997, Gordon Mertz was seen for the last time at the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) on East White Hills road in St. John's, Newfoundland. Gordon worked as a Fisheries Scientist, and records show that he logged off of his computer and left the building shortly after 5:15 p.m.

Case reference: 2012020179.CaseDesc: This adult Caucasian female was recovered from a freight yard north of 127 Water Street. in Vancouver.

Case reference: 2021039166.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2003, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in the Marshy area, west of 19842 Yonge Street in East Gwillimbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022064117.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2022, the body of this adult woman was discovered after a fire in the 1100 block of View Street in downtown Victoria, British Columbia. Her left ankle was surgically repaired with a plate and screws, and she wore glittery blue toenail polish. She was carrying her belongings in a Walmart shopping cart and sheltering under a light green tarp.

Foreign Object: Left Ankle, Metal plate with serial numbers or Surgical plate with serial numbers

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002435.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1978, Mary Click was seen for the last time as she left her home in Madison, Wisconsin. Mary had crossed the American and Canadian border at Pigeon River and intending to hitch hike to Banff, Alberta. Some of her personal belongings were discovered in Thunder Bay, Ontario on July 1, 1978 and Raith, Ontario on August 1, 1978.

Boots: Brown, HIKING, Possibly wearing hiking boots

Case reference: 2014003107.CaseDesc: Jean Fournier was last seen in Montreal on August 30, 1993. He was very stressed and depressed. He left a letter for his wife stating that he was leaving all of his belongings to her. He left his house with little money in his pocket.

Sweater: Cotton, Cream, Ivory, Black, black stripes

Case reference: 2005006199.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1975, the remains of an unidentified man were found in a wooded area near an unused logging road in the northeast corner of North Bay. Anthropological analysis suggests that he may be Caucasian and has been dead in excess of 1-2 years.

Case reference: 2015049567.CaseDesc: Raymond Chalifoux was last seen on May 25th, 2015 at the Fort St John Hospital. Mr. Chalifoux received abdominal surgery and left the hospital against the advice of medical staff. He left in an unknown direction. Extensive searches were conducted with negative results. Mr. Chalifoux has not been seen or heard from since.

Vest: Black, Black vest with designs on chest

Case reference: 2012020084.CaseDesc: Kenneth Kettleson was an avid hunter and outdoorsman, and he led a reclusive lifestyle. Kenneth had not been seen for two weeks before he was reported missing. His residence was secure, and his vehicle was in the yard.

Case reference: 2009004299.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1973, Madeleine Van Overdijk was reported missing by her husband.  She was last seen at her residence in Brantford, Ontario. Information reported to police suggested she was going to Toronto.  It is unknown if in fact she made it to Toronto.

Case reference: 2016061368.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1985, this unidentified male was found by a construction crew lying under a bridge at Spadina and Lakeshore Blvd. He was then taken to Toronto Western Hospital Emergency Department, where he never regained consciousness and died on April 17, 1985.

Hair: Grey, White, medium length hair; a grey moustache and a two-day old beard

Case reference: 2008003999.CaseDesc: Bernard Champagne was last seen on July 10, 1997.  He was a bachelor and lived alone for 40 years in a cabin with no running water or electricity, located behind the Rodrigue residence.  Richard Rodrigue was concerned that night had fallen and Mr. Champagne had not returned to his cabin.  Mr. Rodrigue contacted the police and a search by canine, helicopter, and E.R.T. was conducted but proved unsuccessful in locating Mr. Champagne.

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2014004877.CaseDesc: On February 9, 2006, Michelle Mercer was seen for the last time walking away from an argument with her boyfriend, in the area of 105 Street and 69 Avenue in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014004406.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1973, Caroline Burns was last seen in the early morning leaving her residence in Molanosa, SK. Molanosa is a small isolated community approximately 70 kilometers south of La Ronge, SK. Extensive searches of the area at the time failed to reveal any trace of Ms. Burns.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing left top molar and left front tooth
Mark: Right Knee, Burn mark on side of either left or right knee

Case reference: 2014002904.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1980, Marcel Lapointe was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Mark: Right Eye, Mole near right eye

Case reference: 2019030954.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2019, Tara Sculptor was seen for the last time by her mother on Carling Avenue in Ottawa, Ontario. It is possible that Tara took a bus from Ottawa to North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, A bald spot on the back of the head
Scar: Forehead, Severe burns to the face
Right Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Left Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Back Of Head, Skin graft removed from behind

Case reference: 2017040789.CaseDesc: In 2016, Samantha Fiddler left Canada to go to the state of Florida in the United States of America. Samantha was last known to be in the area of Bartow, Florida. Her family has not heard from her since November 2016.

Case reference: 2018041855.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1992, Grayce Baxter was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. She was a known transgendered sex trade worker. She had a transaction with Patrick Johnson who subsequently confessed to her homicide. Grayce’s remains were never recovered.

Coat: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Fur, Full length coat

Case reference: 2006019799.CaseDesc: Anthony Evans was last seen on Jarvis Lake on June 12, 1984.  He fell from the boat he was in and his body has not been recovered.

Boots: Leather, Brown, Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2020007351.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1981, at approximately 3:00pm, Maria Cowan was last seen as she left her home with a friend to go shopping in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Leather, Brown, Fur on collar and sleeves

Case reference: 2006020699.CaseDesc: Frank Turtle was last seen on May 12, 1994 at South Camp on Peishk Lake, near Red Lake, Ontario. His boat was found but Mr. Turtle was never found.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020106.CaseDesc: Danielle Boisvert, 18 years old, disappeared November 6, 1979. On that day, Danielle was last seen leaving a bar in Montreal-North, Québec.

Case reference: 2014002090.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2000, Stephane Levesque was seen for the last time at his home in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Stephane went to move his car from one side of the street to the other, and he never came back.

Coat: Black, Winter coat with Skidoo written in yellow

Case reference: 2013000037.CaseDesc: On November 29, 2001, Henry Murillo Asprilla was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. On that day, he had a meeting with lawyers, which he attended with his ex-wife. After the meeting he drove his ex-wife home. Henry has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019062090.CaseDesc: On October 26, 2019, Maysa Nouasri was last seen with her father, Larbi Nouasri, in the borough of Saint-Léonard in Montreal, Quebec. It is believed that the two have travelled to Algeria, without Maysa’s mother’s consent.

Case reference: 2006005999.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1994, the body of a male was found in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 120 lbs and his length was measured approximately 5’8"-5’9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days to several weeks.

Teeth: Natural teeth with amalgam fillings on numerous teeth
Scar: Left Forearm, Z-plasty scar, 6x5x7cm, may have been the result of plastic surgery following a fracture
Right Ring Finger, Small linear scar on the knuckle, 2cm

Case reference: 2017047335.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2017, skeletal remains were found at the Montreal River Harbor located on Lake Superior. The location is approximately one hour north of Sault Ste. Marie on Highway 17. The Ontario Forensic Pathology Service has been able to determine that the remains are that of a male age 50-100 years old. Found on him was Canadian currency dated 2016, therefore it is believed he may have been there as early as the Spring of 2016. It is unknown how the male travelled to this area, but it is believed that he may have taken a bus, walked or hitchhiked.  He was carrying a back pack with camping supplies along with a firearm that would have been concealed in a cardboard box. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2008004699.CaseDesc: Adave Francis was last seen October 12, 1999, at 6:00 p.m. riding his bicycle on the farm property located at Poplar side road in the Collingwood area. Mr. Francis was a seasonal worker from Jamaica.

Case reference: 2012020066.CaseDesc: On October 22, 1988, in the early evening Betsy Owens was playing volleyball at the local school in Pauingassi, Manitoba. At approximately 11:00 pm Betsy left the school with her boyfriend, returning to his residence. Betsy was last seen by her boyfriend the following morning when she left his home. Despite several searches, Miss. Owens has not been found. An extensive investigation was conducted at the time and again in 1996-1997. Betsy's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2010001399.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2009, Trevor Andrews was seen for the last time when he left a friend's house in a residential area of London, Ontario, intending to catch a bus to go home. He never returned home to his father's apartment. It cannot be confirmed that he got on the bus. Trevor is known to be very sociable. He would be noticed because of his energetic behaviour. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Aboriginal descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand

Case reference: 2007001599.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Robert St. Louis was seen for the last time when left his home in the Laval-Ouest district in Laval, Quebec. Robert left without his wallet and truck keys. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2012020126.CaseDesc: Rollande Doherty, 52 years old, disappeared on February 2nd 2007. She was last seen around 2:30pm near the library in Rouyn-Noranda.

Case reference: 2014004478.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004, Norman Halkett was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Elbow, Transverse fracture across base of olecranon

Case reference: 2014005108.CaseDesc: On May 20, 2008, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Zhebglin Park was seen for the last time at his home in the Tom Clove Villa Residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020051250.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1983, an unidentified woman died. Shortly before her death, she was observed in the Montreal, Quebec area.

Case reference: 2014005727.CaseDesc: Ryan Slobodzian was last seen when he was dropped off on Henry Avenue. Mr. Slobodzian has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Backpack: Unknown, May have been carrying at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2012020658.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1993, Joyce Tillotson was last seen in Regina, Saskatchewan, when she left her residence to visit a friend. She never arrived at her friend’s home. Joyce was originally from the Carry The Kettle First Nation near Indian Head in Saskatchewan.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , "TR" text on bicep

Case reference: 2014005541.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2010, Shawn Smith was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. On September 6, Shawn arrived in the Dominican Republic and was scheduled to return on the September 12, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2014004798.CaseDesc: On the 25th of October, 1954, Tersilla Bonthoux, 79 years old, was last seen walking from Duck Lake towards the farm homestead where she used to reside, approximately 13 km away. Ms. Bonthoux was reported missing and extensive searches of the area failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2013000034.CaseDesc: Lucie Constantineau was last seen on July 25, 2008 in the Parc-Extension in Montreal, Quebec. Lucie was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Teeth: Braces, partial denture on the 4 front teeth of the upper jaw
Amputation: Right Ear, Missing part of an ear lobe

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2012020072.CaseDesc: Claudette Osborne (nee Tyo) was last seen on the morning of July 25, 2008  walking away from the Lincoln Motor Inn on McPhillips Street.

Hair: Brown, Blonde, Straight, Long, bottom 12" dyed blonde
